title: Congratulating Amber Gance of Endicott, New York, upon the occasion of winning the 2009-2010 National American Miss New York Pageant
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION congratulating Amber Gance of Endicott, New York,
upon  the  occasion  of winning the 2009-2010 National American Miss New
York Pageant

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  the
talent, skill, dedication and commitment of our young people who distin-
guish  themselves  through  excellence in national pageant competitions;
and
  WHEREAS, It is also the custom of this Legislative Body to commend and
pay tribute to those who, by achieving outstanding success  in  national
pageant  competitions,  have  inspired and brought pride to our majestic
Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late Amber Gance upon the occasion of  winning  the  2009-2010  National
American Miss New York Pageant; and
  WHEREAS,  The  National  American Miss pageant is held for young girls
and is dedicated to celebrating America's greatness and encouraging  its
future leaders; the pageants recognize and assist in the development and
empowerment of young women nationwide; and
  WHEREAS, Based on inner beauty, as well as poise and presentation, the
National  American  Miss pageants are for "Today's Girl" and "Tomorrow's
Leaders"; emphasis is placed on the importance  of  gaining  self-confi-
dence,  building  new skills, learning good attitudes about competition,
and achieving personal goals; and
  WHEREAS, Amber Gance, a 14-year-old who  has  earned  the  prestigious
title of the 2009-2010 National American Miss New York, competed against
60  other  state  finalists  in  Rochester; she also earned first in the
title, Talent Miss New York, for her vocal entry  and  was  awarded  the
Contestants Choice for Most Friendly; and
  WHEREAS,  The  pageant  seeks to recognize the accomplishments of each
girl while encouraging her to set goals for the future; her other inter-
ests include, performing at Endicott Performing Arts Center and with the
Summer Savoyards, attending Kathy  Hansen  School  of  Dance  and  vocal
performance lessons from Hilary Kline Rensi, as well as participating in
sports at Union-Endicott Middle School; and
  WHEREAS,  With  her  throughout  have been her parents, Kurt and Linda
Gance, both of whom feel privileged to be a part of her life and rejoice
in her achievements; and
  WHEREAS, It is appropriate to celebrate the accomplishments of remark-
able young people in this great Empire State who participate in national
pageant competitions; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate  Amber  Gance  of  Endicott, New York, upon the occasion of
winning the 2009-2010 National American Miss New York Pageant; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Amber Gance, Endicott, New York.
